heading: HB01764
0: AN ACT INSTITUTIONALIZING THE NATIONAL SCHOOL FEEDING PROGRAM FOR PUBLIC KINDERGARTEN AND ELEMENTARY PUPILS AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
mother-bill statusstatus: Republic Act RA11037 enacted on 2018-06-20 Substituted by HB05269
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB01764
FULL TITLE : AN ACT INSTITUTIONALIZING THE NATIONAL SCHOOL FEEDING PROGRAM FOR PUBLIC KINDERGARTEN AND ELEMENTARY PUPILS AND APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR
SHORT TITLE : National School Feeding Program (nsfp) Act
ABSTRACT : Seeks to promote and fortify proper nutrition among school children, especially those belonging to low-income households, in order to safeguard them from the ill effects of malnutrition and to enhance as well their learning capacities.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : ZARATE, CARLOS ISAGANI T.
DATE FILED : 2016-07-20
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
NATURE : Welfare
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Mending (045 2016-11-16)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Referred to Stakeholders on 2016-09-14
          -DepED
      2. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2016-12-06
      3. Approved by the Committee on 2016-12-06
      4. Transmitted to the Committee on Appropriations on 2016-12-13
          -Unnumbered House Bill in substitution of House Bills Numbered 34, 246, 448, 1428, 1438, 1558, 1764, 1970, 2616, 2990, 3070, 3276 and 3371.
      5. Transmmitted to the Committee on Ways and Means on 2016-12-13
          -Unnumbered House Bill in substitution of House Bills Numbered 34, 246, 448, 1428, 1438, 1558, 1764, 1970, 2616, 2990, 3070, 3276 and 3371.
      6. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2017-02-22
      7. Approved by the Committee on Appropriations on 2017-02-22
          -Unnumbered House Bill in substitution of House Bills Numbered 34, 246, 448, 1428, 1438, 1558, 1764, 1970, 2616, 2990, 3070, 3276 and 3371.
      8. Approved by the Committee on Appropriations on 2017-02-22
          -Substitute Bill to House Bill Nos. 34, 246, 448, 1428, 1438, 1558, 1764, 1970, 2616, 2990, 3070, 3276 and 3371 was approved without amendment.
MOTHER BILL: HB05269
